title: Physics-Informed Machine Learning for Transformer Condition Monitoring -- Part I: Basic Concepts, Neural Networks, and Variants
summary: Power transformers are critical assets in power networks, whose reliability directly impacts grid resilience and stability. Traditional condition monitoring approaches, often rule-based or purely physics-based, struggle with uncertainty, limited data availability, and the complexity of modern operating conditions.
